intro: Bidens bimucronata, commonly known as the two-edged tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features opposite, hairy leaves and produces small yellow flowers with dark centers. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Bidens bimucronata is also known for its ability to spread rapidly through seeds and is sometimes considered a weed.
